title: Münchner Merkur Galliard -esque newspaper nameplate
content:
I spotted this amazing logo in München recently,

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110153805im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-12-22%20at%209_6312.16.00%20am.png)

Doing some research I saw that their [current name plate](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110153805/http:/www.pi-news.net/wp/uploads/2011/05/M%C3%BCnchner-Merkur.jpg) is not this one, and quite uninspiring

Digging further back I found examples that are close and look like a condense Galliard, but are definitely not the same as the photo I took:  
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110153805im_/http:/www.subsidiumev.de/upload_images/muenchner-merkur.jpg)  
Notice especially the way the r hooks around in a brush-like or talon like manner in the photo.

Any help is appreciated!
author: jaylangly

comments.content:
I trust you will get a good answer if you post your request at the Font Identification forum [http://typophile.com/typeid](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110153805/http:/typophile.com/typeid "http://typophile.com/typeid")  
look forward to seeing you there.  
Don
My apologies, I did not realise I had posted it to the general forums — I will repost, and hopefully a moderator (is Typophile moderated these days?) can delete this one.
